meanings.definition: A person who grants a fee or estate.
meanings.sent1: The feoffers handed over the property deed to the new owner.
meanings.sent2: The feoffers generously gifted the land to their children.
meanings.sent3: The feoffers joked about being the kings of their own little kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The feoffers were like fairy godparents, bestowing riches upon their heirs.
meanings.sent5: The feoffers were known far and wide for their acts of generosity.

meanings.definition: To grant a fee or estate to someone.
meanings.sent1: They feoffer the land to the villagers for their use.
meanings.sent2: She feoffers the estate to her loyal servant in gratitude.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to feoffer the property as a surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: He feoffers his love and devotion to his partner every day.
meanings.sent5: The king would feoffer his kingdom to the bravest knight.
